articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — Former Vice President Mike Pence drops his bid for the Republican presidential nomination.
articles.title: Former Vice President Mike Pence drops his bid for the Republican presidential nomination

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE, JULIA FRANKEL and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told the nation Saturday night that the military has opened a “second stage” in the war against Hamas by sending ground forces into Gaza and expanding attacks from the ground, air and sea.
articles.title: Netanyahu says the Gaza war has entered a new stage and will be 'long and difficult'

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Israel launched an expanded ground operation on Saturday after knocking out communications and creating a near-blackout of information in the Gaza Strip with increased bombardment and artillery fire overnight.
articles.title: Live updates | Israel pounds Gaza strip, dismissing calls for cease-fire

articles.author: JAKE BLEIBERG, PATRICK WHITTLE and DAVID SHARP
articles.description: LEWISTON, Maine (AP) — A U.S. Army reservist who opened fire at a Maine bowling alley and a bar earlier this week and killed 18 people purchased his weapons legally, authorities said Saturday, adding he likely launched his rampage as a result of underlying mental health issues.
articles.title: Mass killing suspect had mental health issues, purchased guns legally, authorities say

articles.author: HOLLY RAMER and MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: LEWISTON, Maine (AP) — The first loud noise 10-year-old Toni Asselin heard sounded like the thwack of a ball being hit hard across a pool table. She thought the second might have been someone dropping a bowling ball.
articles.title: When a man began shooting in Maine, some froze while others ran. Now they're left with questions

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — It was neither the place nor the time for a proper goodbye, said Omar Dirawi. Not here, in this dusty field strewn with dead people wrapped in blankets and zipped up in body bags.
articles.title: Mass graves, unclaimed bodies and overcrowded cemeteries. The war robs Gaza of funeral rites

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Jeep maker Stellantis has reached a tentative contract agreement with the United Auto Workers union that follows a template set earlier this week by Ford, two people with knowledge of the negotiations said Saturday.
articles.title: AP Sources: Auto workers and Stellantis reach tentative contract deal that follows model set by Ford

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — New House Speaker Mike Johnson inherits many of the same problems that bedeviled Republican leaders with far more experience.
articles.title: New Speaker Mike Johnson holds favor with conservatives. Can he unite the GOP where others failed?

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — An Iranian teenage girl injured weeks ago in a mysterious incident on Tehran's Metro while not wearing a headscarf has died, state media reported Saturday.
articles.title: An Iranian teenager injured on Tehran Metro while not wearing a headscarf has died, state media say

articles.author: MEGAN JANETSKY
articles.description: ACAPULCO, Mexico (AP) — Government workers and volunteers cleared streets, gas station lines wrapped around the block for what gas was to be had, and some lucky families found food essentials as a more organized relief operation took shape Saturday in Acapulco, four days after Hurricane Otis.
articles.title: Relief work begins to take shape in Acapulco as residents continue search for essentials after Otis
